Module com.inventorysystem
Package com.inventorysystem

Class mainFormController

java.lang.Object
com.inventorysystem.mainFormController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class mainFormController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This is the controller for the mainForm page. The purpose of this controller is to control the UI for the main page.
Author:
Carlos Rodriguez

    • idCounter

      public static int idCounter
      This keeps track of the id to assign to all parts and objects. FUTURE ENHANCEMENT Originally I was going to use a for loop to set the initial starting value, but found that It is optional The idCounter should be equal to the number of starting parts and products. We should implement a more diverse way of generating an ID.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(java.net.URL url, java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method sets up the two tables on the mainForm page. On initialization the method will set up the Part table and Product table.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • idGenerator

      public static int idGenerator()
      This method sets up a system to generate unique ID's for all parts and products. Everytime a part or product is created, the ID generator will increase by 1 and use this to create a new ID. FUTURE ENHANCEMENT We should include a way of making each ID unique and random, not just increasing by 1.

    • switchToAddPartForm

      public void switchToAddPartForm​(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws java.io.IOException
      This method takes the user to the addPart page. On clicking the button connected to this method, it will direct the user to the proper page.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

      public void exitButton() throws java.io.IOException

      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • deleteButtonPart

      public void deleteButtonPart​(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws java.io.IOException
      This method deletes a part from the part table. Will delete selected part but uses a system of checks for error handling. RUNTIME ERROR Didn't realize that an error was occuring when pressing delete while selectedPart was null. We fixed this by checking first to see if selectedPart is not null and then only continuing with the rest of the code if it has a value.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • deleteButtonProduct

      public void deleteButtonProduct​(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws java.io.IOException
      This method deletes a part from the product table. Will delete selected product but uses a system of checks for error handling. RUNTIME ERROR Didn't realize that an error was occuring when pressing delete while selectedProduct was null. We fixed this by checking first to see if selectedProduct is not null and then only continuing with the rest of the code if it has a value.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • countAssociatedParts

      public int countAssociatedParts​(Product selectedPart)
      This method returns the number of associated parts the product holds. This method counts the number of associated parts to the product. Used for checking if deleting the product is allowed.
      Parameters:
      selectedPart - This is the product to be checked.
      Returns:
      Returns the number of associated parts in the product.

    • searchPartTable

      public void searchPartTable​(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      This method regulates how the app searches through the part table. When text is entered in the search bar, the method will run through checks to filter out the table.

    • searchProductTable

      public void searchProductTable​(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      This method regulates how the app searches through the product table. When text is entered in the search bar, the method will run through checks to filter out the table.
